ygData.subject: Re: New Spells Info
ygData.msgSnippet: What do you excpect for a radius spell? Radius spells have allways been weaker than direct effect spells. I only use 1 or 2 radius spells anymore..and they
ygData.messageBody:
What do you excpect for a radius spell? Radius spells have allways been
weaker than direct effect spells. I only use 1 or 2 radius spells
anymore..and they have to be in a place where we constantly take on more
than 3 critters. Other than that I dont even have them memorized! I expect
the radius spells to become better in in time does anyone know what kind of
dmage/mana ratio the Column of Lightning is?


~ Auraelle Dracul ~
~Priestess of Veeshan~
~ Follower of Tunare ~
~ Lords of Light ~

----- Original Message -----
From: James Guintu <james@...>
To: <eq_wizards@onelist.com>
Sent: Wednesday, June 30, 1999 4:56 PM
Subject: Re: [eq_wizards] New Spells Info


> From: "James Guintu" <james@...>
>
> Were these druids referring to out level 39 root upgrade "Immobolize"? I
> hear that this one is definately the best of the root series. And btw, I
> just read an email from GZ, the druid roots are resisted EXACTLY as much
as
> all other roots in the game...
>
> And I don't really feel bad about Bonds of Force, I'm definately not
pissed
> about it since it was an extra I didn't expect but I am disappointed with
> its functionality. If and when you test it against a druid's ensnare
you'll
> know what I mean.
>
> Euros Arcane
> Rallos Zek
>
>
> From: mstokes <mstokes@...>
>
> >
>
> Don't feel to bad about ensnare. I just got finished "discussing" root
and
> ensnare with a couple of high level druids on a message board. Basically
> they
> wanted a reliable root spell like wizards instead of their ensnare line.
I
> guess its true, The grass is always greener on the other side.
>
>
>
